intro: Mattiastrum ancyritanum, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dark, almost black, bark and its ability to thrive in saline environments. The plant has small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. It plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems by stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
